args.natural_language_statement: Prove that SL(n) ⊳ GL(n) and GL(n)/SL(n) ≅ R^×.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap
open Subgroup

/-- Prove that SL(n) ⊳ GL(n) and GL(n)/SL(n) ≅ R^×. -/
theorem SL_top_normal_and_quotient_top_iso_R_units :
    (⊤ : Subgroup (GL (Fin n) R)).Normal ∧
      (GL (Fin n) R) ⧸ ⊤ ≃* Rˣ := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Prove that SL(n) is a normal subgroup of GL(n) and that the quotient GL(n)/SL(n) is isomorphic to Rˣ. -/
theorem SL_normal_and_quotient_iso_R_units (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] :
  (SL (Fin n) R) ⊲ (GL (Fin n) R) ∧ (GL (Fin n) R) ⧸ (SL (Fin n) R) ≃* Rˣ := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Prove that SL n R is a normal subgroup of GL n R and that the quotient GL n R / SL n R is isomorphic to Rˣ. -/
theorem SL_normal_and_quotient_iso_R_units (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] :
  (SL n R) ⊲ (GL n R) ∧ (GL n R) ⧸ (SL n R) ≃* Rˣ := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Prove that SL (Fin n) R is a normal subgroup of GL (Fin n) R and that the quotient GL (Fin n) R / SL (Fin n) R is isomorphic to Rˣ. -/
theorem SL_normal_and_quotient_iso_R_units (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] :

args.natural_language_statement: Prove that SL(n) is a normal subgroup of GL(n) and GL(n)/SL(n) is isomorphic to R×.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap
open Subgroup
open scoped Classical in
open scoped MatrixGroups

/-- Prove that SL(n) is a normal subgroup of GL(n) and GL(n)/SL(n) is isomorphic to R×. -/
theorem SL_normal_subgroup_GL (n : Type u) (R : Type v) [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R] :
    IsNormalSubgroup (SL n R) (GL n R) := sorry"}
